text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify, per German Civ. Pro. Code (ZPO) 1032(1), that German courts must decline jurisdiction when arbitration agreements exist. Section 1(D) of the candidate answer directly addresses this: 'If the defendant invokes the arbitration agreement, German courts typically must refer parties to arbitration unless the agreement is null/void/inoperative/incapable of being performed.' This accurately reflects the mandatory nature of the German arbitration law obligation under ZPO \u00a7 1032(1) (which implements the UNCITRAL Model Law/NYC Convention).", "criterion_id": "1e1996f6-c1bd-451d-a75c-92f3f6fa6094"}
